item.title: Getting Started with Scala
item.author: yanboyang713@gmail.com
item.dc:creator: Boyang Yan
item.description: Overview Scala is a modern multi-paradigm programming language designed to express common programming patterns in a concise, elegant, and type-safe way. Scala has been created by Martin Odersky and he released the first version in 2003. Scala smoothly integrates the features of object-oriented and functional languages. This tutorial explains the basics of Scala in a simple and reader-friendly way. Prerequisites Scala Programming is based on Java, so if you are aware of Java syntax, then it’s pretty easy to learn Scala.
